grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 挨拶【アイサツ】greeting, greetings, salutation, salute, polite set phrase used when meeting or parting from somebody, polite set phrase used to express apology, sympathy, congratulations, etc., speech (congratulatory or appreciative), address, reply, response, revenge, retaliation, a fine thing to say, dialoging (with another Zen practitioner to ascertain their level of enlightenment), relationship (between people), connection, intervention, mediation, mediator
挨拶代わり【アイサツガワリ】substitute for a proper greeting (e.g. gift)
